parts.part_heading: PART 1—BASIC PERMIT REQUIREMENTS UNDER THE FEDERAL ALCOHOL ADMINISTRATION ACT, NONINDUSTRIAL USE OF DISTILLED SPIRITS AND WINE, BULK SALES AND BOTTLING OF DISTILLED SPIRITS
PART 5—LABELING AND ADVERTISING OF DISTILLED SPIRITS

sections.heading: § 5.0   Scope.
paragraphs: This part sets forth requirements that apply to the labeling and packaging of distilled spirits in containers, including requirements for label approval and rules regarding mandatory, regulated, and prohibited labeling statements. This part also sets forth requirements that apply to the advertising of distilled spirits.

parts.part_heading: PART 7—LABELING AND ADVERTISING OF MALT BEVERAGES

sections.heading: § 7.0   Scope.
paragraphs: This part sets forth requirements that apply to the labeling and packaging of malt beverages in containers, including requirements for label approval and rules regarding mandatory, regulated, and prohibited labeling statements. This part also sets forth requirements that apply to the advertising of malt beverages.

sections.heading: § 9.0   Scope.
paragraphs: The regulations in this part relate to American viticultural areas created under the authority of the Federal Alcohol Administration Act and referred to in § 4.25(e) of this chapter.

parts.part_heading: PART 12—FOREIGN NONGENERIC NAMES OF GEOGRAPHIC SIGNIFICANCE USED IN THE DESIGNATION OF WINES
PART 17—DRAWBACK ON TAXPAID DISTILLED SPIRITS USED IN MANUFACTURING NONBEVERAGE PRODUCTS

sections.heading: § 19.0   Scope.
paragraphs: This part concerns the operation of distilled spirits plants in the United States. Topics covered in this part include: Permits and registration procedures; bond requirements; payment of taxes; filing of claims; production, storage, and processing operations; and maintenance of records.

parts.part_heading: PART 20—DISTRIBUTION AND USE OF DENATURED ALCOHOL AND RUM
PART 21—FORMULAS FOR DENATURED ALCOHOL AND RUM
PART 22—DISTRIBUTION AND USE OF TAX-FREE ALCOHOL
PART 26—LIQUORS AND ARTICLES FROM PUERTO RICO AND THE VIRGIN ISLANDS
PART 27—IMPORTATION OF DISTILLED SPIRITS, WINES, AND BEER

sections.heading: § 31.0   Scope.
paragraphs: This part contains the requirements relating to the registration of wholesale and retail dealers in liquors and in beer and to the operations of such dealers, including recordkeeping requirements, prescribed under title 26 of the United States Code. This part also contains provisions relating to entry of dealers' premises and inspection of their records by TTB officers.

PART 45—REMOVAL OF TOBACCO PRODUCTS AND CIGARETTE PAPERS AND TUBES, WITHOUT PAYMENT OF TAX, FOR USE OF THE UNITED STATES
